text: Christchurch Hospital is a hospital in Christchurch, New Zealand. It is the largest hospital in the South Island of New Zealand. == History == The government voted £1,500 to build a hospital in Christchurch in 1861. In 2009, a NZ$400 million proposal was made to replace some of the hospital buildings, including a new 450-bed hospital and a helipad. The construction was suppsoed to start in 2011 but was delayed after the 2011 Christchurch earthquake. After the earthquake, the hospital took care of 164 people with serious injuries. The hospital also took care of 49 people after the Christchurch mosque shootings, 2 of the people died in the hospital. == Notable people == * Courtney Nedwill (1837–1920), public health officer * Catherine Stedman, professor of medicine == Related pages == * Nurses' Memorial Chapel * Princess Margaret Hospital, Christchurch == References == == Other websites == * Christchurch Hospital at the Canterbury District Health Board Category:Buildings and structures in New Zealand Category:Hospitals Category:Christchurch Category:Buildings and structures completed in the 19th century Category:1860s establishments in New Zealand Category:1862 establishments
